Class RegistrationException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
io.github.venkat1701.yugantaarbackend.exceptions.core.BaseDomainModelException
io.github.venkat1701.yugantaarbackend.exceptions.implementation.registrations.RegistrationException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class RegistrationException extends BaseDomainModelException
The RegistrationException class is a custom exception designed to handle errors related to user registration within the application. This exception extends BaseDomainModelException, which serves as the base for domain-specific exceptions, enabling structured handling of registration-related issues.

This exception is intended to be thrown in scenarios where user registration fails, such as when required information is missing, validation rules are not met, or duplicate accounts are detected.

By using this exception, developers can provide clear and specific error messages for registration-related issues, improving the clarity of error handling and debugging.

Usage Example:

     if (username == null || username.isEmpty()) {
         throw new RegistrationException("Username cannot be empty during registration.");
     }

This class includes constructors for specifying only a message or both a message and a cause, allowing for flexible exception reporting based on the context of the failure.

Author: Venkat

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • RegistrationException

      public RegistrationException(String message)
      Constructs a new RegistrationException with the specified detail message.
      Parameters:
      message - the detail message, which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getMessage() method.

    • RegistrationException

      public RegistrationException(String message, Throwable cause)
      Constructs a new RegistrationException with the specified detail message and cause.

      This constructor allows capturing the underlying reason for the registration failure, which can aid in debugging by providing additional context in nested exception scenarios.

      Parameters:
      message - the detail message, saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getMessage() method.
      cause - the cause of the exception, saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getCause() method. A null value is permitted, indicating that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.
